title: Riot Games violate human rights by advocating social justice warrior ideology
body:
Riot Games has taken their "safe environment ethos" too far. Their terms and conditions is now a violation of your freedom of expression.

After tens of thousands of hours of play time over the better part of a decade, and close to $3,000 dollars invested in micro transactions - I can say with the utmost confidence, that Riot Games are advocates of a social justice ideology that violates the spirit of competition and fiercely weakens the fortitude of it's player base by rallying against free speech.

Yes, it's sad folks - the developers behind our beloved League of Legends have politically aligned themselves along side the far leftist social justice warrior ideologs - pretty ironic if you consider recent headlines about bullying, gender discrimination and sexual harrassment coming out of their headquarters.

This commentary comes following a permanent ban on my account for verbalizing my frustrations in the height of competitive passion, something which is seen in every competitive sport across the planet - and let's not pretend that League of Legends doesn't try to position itself in that space.

Now let me ask you in all seriousness - in a game in which every player has the ability to mute unwanted communications with a single click - should exercising your freedom of speech and expression really be a permanently bannable offense? Particularly after such an extensive investment of time and money, how does this not constitute theft?

When a ban is issued for a violation of terms, but said terms violate basic human rights - should actions be legally implementable? Do Riot Games consider themselves above law and constitution?

In order to be able to think, you have to risk being offensive.

This is political correctness taken too far - and clearly the result of millennial decision makers heading HR at Riot Games. 

Riot are over coddling their player base, and giving players too much control over the fate of others. The reporting system for example - It's far too easy for a player to get caught up in a competitive emotional quarrel and reflexively report people in heat of the moment. 

Stop being ratty little snitches and take it on the chin - the only behavior that should be bannable is player action that INTENTIONALLY contribute to losses - like feeding, trolling etc. 

Exercising your freedom to taunt, provoke and vent is innate to human nature - and in competitive environments, can add will to the drama and excitement of the matches unfolding - which is why it is so common in sport.

Take the UFC for example, where flaming and provoking the opponent is a crucial part of the marketing and hype building process - which adds another dimension to the way the sport plays out both from the experience of combatants and audience.

There's nothing more thrilling and rewarding than simply outclassing another competitor after he's spend the last 20 minutes trying to tilt you by telling you that he fucked your %%%%%% mother. There is no better feeling for the victor, and no better lesson for the loser.

Let's face it, we get passionate about things that we love, and this is amplified by competition - and when we're passionate about something, we're going to get emotional, and we're going to say shit and do shit we don't mean - and part of being human is recognizing that in others and turning the other cheek. 

There's no honor in reporting someone for venting their frustrations in the heat of competitive passion.

There's even less honor in facilitating the ability to carry out that process.

If Riot want to remain relevant and prevent their player count from dropping, they need to stop releasing shitty new content that no one cares about, and address what matters.

Understanding that the most passionate players are the ones who love them the most is a good place to start.

2.  Secondly you say "Do Riot Games consider themselves above law and constitution?"; what law and constitution. Riot is a company that has it's player base in a lot of countrys and they all have different laws.

3. Then you say "Stop being ratty little snitches and take it on the chin - the only behavior that should be bannable is player action that INTENTIONALLY contribute to losses - like feeding, trolling etc.".
